name: rex-server
description: Rex Server is a Node.js-based reverse proxy server available as an npm package. It allows you to handle HTTP and HTTPS traffic, route requests to upstream servers, and manage worker processes efficiently. With its CLI interface, Rex makes it easy to configure and run a proxy server with custom settings.

scripts.dev: nodemon --ext ts,json,yaml --exec ts-node -r tsconfig-paths/register src/cli/main.ts start
scripts.build: rm -rf dist && tsc --build && tsc-alias && ts-node src/scripts/updateConf && cp -r ./src/logs ./src/static dist && rsync -av --exclude='conf.ts' ./src/conf/ dist/conf/ && touch dist/conf/master.pid
scripts.stop: ps aux | grep node | awk '{print $2}' | xargs kill
scripts.start: node dist/cli/main.js stop > /dev/null 2>&1; npm run build && node dist/cli/main.js start

author: Raghvendra Misra
